title: Comparative Global Entrepreneurship Education for Adult Working Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of core business concepts and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Provides practical insights through comparative analysis of multicultural entrepreneurial cases, strengthening experience-sharing via collaborative activities among learners.

learning_goals: Analyze cultural differences by comparing entrepreneurial education models in Indonesia and Malaysia

Learners diagnose entrepreneurial environments within organizations by measuring at least three indicators using learning climate, interest level, and attitude assessment tools (e.g., surveys, observation checklists) and write diagnostic reports according to standardized analytical frameworks (e.g., 5-point Likert scale).
Design customized educational strategies applicable to one’s work environment based on comparative research findings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
